trans-unit.source: Implements the basic functionality required by a spin box (also known as an up-down control).
A spin box consists of a text box and a small vertical scroll bar, commonly referred to as a spin button control.

The UpDownBase class links the two controls and allows the user to change the display in the text box by clicking the up or down buttons or by entering the appropriate type of value directly into the text box.
Use the spin box in cases where you want to limit the list of values a user can select, similar to a list box or combo box.
Depending upon the type of list you want to display, the advantage to using a spin box is that it allows you to quickly set a range of valid values, rather than adding items one at a time.
Implementing a spin box requires less data validation than a text box, as you can limit the data type when you derive a class from UpDownBase.

An example of this is the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.NumericUpDown> class, which limits the values to the numeric type and uses a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.NumericUpDown.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.NumericUpDown.Maximum%2A> property to validate the data.
To allow the user to use the arrow keys to change the contents of a spin box, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.InterceptArrowKeys%2A> property to `true`.
To restrict the user to values you specify, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ReadOnly%2A> property to `true`.
To control the alignment of text in the spin box, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.TextAlign%2A> property.

To set the alignment of the up and down buttons in relation to the text box portion of the control, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpDownAlign%2A> property to either <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LeftRightAlignment> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LeftRightAlignment>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpButton%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.DownButton%2A> methods, when overridden, handle the clicking of the up or down buttons.

When overridden, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ValidateEditText%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpdateEditText%2A> methods validate the value (either selected or entered) and update the text displayed in the spin box.
If the value fails validation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Select%2A> method to select the text that is not valid.
This allows the user to quickly correct the text by simply typing in a new value without having to manually select or delete the existing text.

Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_2015](~/add/includes/net-2015-md.md)], the UpDownBase control will be resized based on the system DPI setting when the app.config file contains the following entry: ``` <appSettings> Â <add key="EnableWindowsFormsHighDpiAutoResizing" value="true" /> </appSettings> ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the container will allow the user to scroll to any controls placed outside of its visible boundaries.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control does not use the AutoScroll property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> in all cases.
Gets or sets the size of the auto-scroll margin.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control does not use the AutoScrollMargin property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the height and width, in pixels, of the auto-scroll margin.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Height*> or <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Width*> is less than 0.
Gets or sets the minimum size of the auto-scroll area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control does not use the AutoScrollMinSize property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the minimum height and width, in pixels, of the scroll bars.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control should automatically resize based on its contents.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate the control should automatically resize based on its contents; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.AutoSize*> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the background color for the text box portion of the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the text box portion of the spin box.
Gets or sets the background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref>.
The BackgroundImage property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.
The background image for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.BackgroundImage*> property changes.
To be added.
Gets or sets the layout of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.BackgroundImage*> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref>.
The BackgroundImageLayout property has no effect on the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control; therefore, it is hidden in the designer and from IntelliSense.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout"></xref> values.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.BackgroundImageLayout*> property changes.
To be added.
Gets or sets the border style for the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase.BorderStyle%2A> property to create borderless and flat controls in addition to the default three-dimensional control.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle"></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.BorderStyle"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text property is being changed internally by its parent class.
The ChangingText property acts as a flag for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> class.
This property is used by derived classes to indicate when the class is changing the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property internally.

If this property is set to `false`, the control requires that the user is changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property and will set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UserEdit%2A> property to `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text*> property is being changed internally by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> class; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the shortcut menu associated with the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The preferred way to associate a shortcut menu with a tree node is with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ContextMenuStrip%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu"></xref> associated with the spin box.
Gets or sets the shortcut menu for the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The shortcut menu appears when the user right-clicks the spin box.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenuStrip"></xref> associated with the control.
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
The creation parameters.
Gets the default size of the control.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the control.
Gets the dock padding settings for all edges of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase> control does not use the DockPadding property.
The dock paddings settings for this control.
When overridden in a derived class, handles the clicking of the down button on the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
Gets a value indicating whether the control has input focus.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control has focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the foreground color of the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The ForeColor property will change the color of the text in the textbox portion of the spin box.
The foreground <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the spin box.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can use the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys to select values.
If the InterceptArrowKeys property is set to `true` and the spin box (also known as an up-down control) has focus, the user can use the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys to select values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control allows the use of the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys to select values; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum size of the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
Regardless of the specified value, the <xref:System.Drawing.Size.Height%2A> of the maximum size will always be 0.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref>, which is the maximum size of the spin box.
Gets or sets the minimum size of the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref>, which is the minimum size of the spin box.
Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> control.
To be added.
Occurs when the mouse pointer rests on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> control.
To be added.
Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> control.
To be added.
Occurs when the user moves the mouse pointer over the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase"></xref> control.
To be added.
When overridden in a derived class, raises the Changed event.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.FontChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnFontChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleCreated"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnHandleCreated method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.HandleDestroyed"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnHandleDestroyed method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnLayout method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseDown method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseUp"></xref> event.
If a double-click occurs, the OnMouseUp method will raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoubleClick> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseUp method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel"></xref> event.

If the spin box (also known as an up-down control) has focus when this event occurs, the direction the user scrolled the mouse wheel is determined, and either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpButton%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.DownButton%2A> method is called.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnMouseWheel method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnPaint method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown"></xref> event.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.InterceptArrowKeys%2A> property is set to `true` and the user presses the UP ARROW key, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpButton%2A> method is called.
Likewise, if the user presses the DOWN ARROW key, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.DownButton%2A> method is called.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnTextBoxKeyDown method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnTextBoxKeyPress method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.LostFocus"></xref> event.
This method validates the text in the text box portion of the control when the spin box (also known as an up-down control) loses focus.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnTextBoxLostFocus method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize"></xref> event.
This method adjusts the size of the spin box (also known as an up-down control) when the text box portion of the control is resized.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnTextBoxResize method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.TextChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnTextBoxTextChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Gets the height of the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The PreferredHeight property value is based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBoxBase.PreferredHeight%2A> property of the text box portion of the control and is adjusted for the style of border.
The height, in pixels, of the spin box.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text can be changed by the use of the up or down buttons only.
By setting the ReadOnly property to `true`, you will eliminate the need for much validation of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property.
The user will be restricted to the use of the up and down buttons to change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> values.
It will only allow them to select values you specify.
> [!NOTE] > In the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DomainUpDown>, the behavior described is slightly different.
When ReadOnly is set to `true` and a key is pressed, the control selects the first item in the collection where the first character matches the key pressed.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the text can be changed by the use of the up or down buttons only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Selects a range of text in the spin box (also known as an up-down control) specifying the starting position and number of characters to select.
The Select method can be used when the spin box gets focus, or when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property fails data validation.
When adding the validation code for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ValidateEditText%2A> method in a derived class, call the Select method when validation fails.
The position of the first character to be selected.
The total number of characters to be selected.
Gets or sets the text displayed in the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpdateEditText%2A> method is called if the Text property is set while the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UserEdit%2A> property is set to `true`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ValidateEditText%2A> method is called if the Text property is set while the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UserEdit%2A> property is set to `false`.
The string value displayed in the spin box.
Gets or sets the alignment of the text in the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment"></xref> values.
When overridden in a derived class, handles the clicking of the up button on the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
When overridden in a derived class, updates the text displayed in the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
Gets or sets the alignment of the up and down buttons on the spin box (also known as an up-down control).
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LeftRightAlignment"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LeftRightAlignment"></xref>.
The value assigned is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LeftRightAlignment"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a value has been entered by the user.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property is set while the UserEdit property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.UpdateEditText%2A> method is called.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text%2A> property is set while the UserEdit property is set to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.ValidateEditText%2A> method is called.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user has changed the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.UpDownBase.Text*> property; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, validates the text displayed in the spin box (also known as an up-down control).

Some examples of validation include comparing the text entered to the data type set in your derived class, comparing the text to a list of values, or verifying the text to be within a range of values.
Processes Windows messages.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.
